page.title: 12EVENTS IN SALISBURY IN 1985
page.content: The Princess of Wales opened a new ward at Odstock Hospital. Industry was boosted with the developement of the Optica aircraft, very suitable for aerial observation and photography. There was argument when an oil company planned to drill in the water meadows near the cathedral. Many people were worried that if oil were found the beautiful views of the cathedral would vanish. The other controversy was after the County Council elections resulted in gains for the S.D.P.-Liberal Alliance because reorganisation of secondary education in Salisbury was to be discussed again. A new shopping centre on the Maltings with the refurbishment of the City Hall has caused building activity and traffic confusion but should give future benefit to the community.
